title: Frontend Developer Job at Bretty Consultancy Services
content:
Bretty Consultancy Services - Our client, a rapidly growing Edutech firm in Abuja, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Frontend Developer
Job Location: Garki, Abuja
Employment Type: Contract

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Are you a passionate Frontend Developer with a knack for building intuitive and engaging user experiences? Do you thrive in a fast-paced, innovative startup environment?
	Bretty Consultancy is excited to announce an opening for a talented Frontend Developer to join our client, a rapidly growing Edutech firm in Abuja!
	This is a fantastic opportunity to be a key player in a company that's revolutionizing education through technology. You'll work on cutting-edge products, bringing designs to life for both web and mobile platforms.


About the Role


	As a Frontend Developer, you'll be instrumental in creating the interactive and visually appealing interfaces that power our educational platforms.


Your responsibilities will include:


	Developing and maintaining high-quality user interfaces using React.js for web applications.
	Building robust and performant mobile applications with React Native.
	Collaborating closely with UI/UX designers to translate wireframes and mockups into functional, responsive, and aesthetically pleasing code.
	Working with backend developers to integrate frontend components with APIs.
	Optimizing applications for maximum speed and scalability across various devices and browsers.
	Writing clean, well-documented, and maintainable code.
	Participating in code reviews and contributing to a culture of continuous improvement.
	Troubleshooting and debugging issues to ensure a seamless user experience.


Requirements
The ideal candidate will have:


	A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience).
	2+ years of professional experience as a Frontend Developer, with a strong portfolio showcasing your work.
	Proven expertise in React.js and React Native is essential.
	Solid understanding of modern JavaScript (ES6+), HTML5, and CSS3.
	Experience with state management libraries (e.g., Redux, Zustand, Context API).
	Familiarity with version control systems, especially Git.
	Ability to write clean, modular, and reusable code.
	Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
	Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
	Experience in a startup environment or fast-growing company is a plus.


Why Join Our Team?


	Salary: N150,000 - N2000,000 Monthly.
	Be a part of a fast-growing Edutech startup that's making a real difference in education.
	Work on exciting and impactful projects with modern technologies.
	Join a dynamic, collaborative, and innovative team where your ideas are valued.
	Significant opportunities for professional growth and career advancement as we scale.
	Competitive salary and a vibrant work environment in Abuja.e


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume, Cover Letter, and a link to your portfolio / GitHub profile to: brettyconsultancyservices@gmail.com using "Frontend Developer - [Your Name]" as the subject of the mail.

Note


	Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
	If you're a self-starter with a passion for frontend development and a desire to contribute to the future of learning, we'd love to hear from you!
    

    

        Click here to Apply

title: Executive General Manager Job at NeoHomes Limited
content:
NeoHomes Limited is a leading real estate company with a vision to become a globally recognized brand. We're seeking an experienced Executive General Manager to join our leadership team and drive business growth, innovation, and excellence.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive General Manager

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	As an Executive General Manager, you'll be responsible for overseeing the overall strategy, operations, and performance of our company.
	You'll lead cross-functional teams, drive business development, and ensure that our company delivers exceptional customer experiences and achieves its business objectives.


Responsibilities


	Develop and execute business strategies that drive growth, innovation, and profitability.
	Oversee daily operations, ensuring efficiency, productivity, and quality.
	Identify and pursue new business opportunities, partnerships, and revenue streams.
	Lead and develop high-performing teams, fostering a culture of excellence and innovation.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders, including customers, investors, and partners.


Requirements


	15+ years of experience in real estate or a related industry
	Proven track record of leadership and business growth
	Strong strategic thinking and problem-solving skills
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
	Strong business acumen and financial management skills


Skills:


	Experience in global business operations
	Knowledge of real estate market trends and regulations
	Network of industry contacts and partnerships.


Benefits


	Competitive salary
	Opportunity to lead a dynamic and growing company
	Collaborative and innovative work environment
	Professional development and growth opportunities


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter to: humanresources@neohomesltd.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.




Note


	If you're a seasoned leader with a passion for real estate and business growth, we'd love to hear from you! Join our team and help shape the future of NeoHomes Limited.

title: Accountant Job at Brooks Insights Limited
content:
Brooks Insights Limited (Brooks Insights) is an independent consulting firm committed to providing evidence-based insights for improved health and development through research, program monitoring and evaluation, knowledge product development, capacity building, and technical support.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilties
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Maintain accurate records of financial transactions using approved accounting software.
	Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements and management reports.
	Reconcile bank statements and general ledger accounts.
	Ensure timely preparation of trial balances, income statements, and balance sheets.
	Manage accounting for donor-funded projects, ensuring strict compliance with donor policies and requirements.
	Ensure proper allocation of shared costs across grants and operational activities.
	Assist in the preparation of project budgets, annual budgets, forecasts, and financial plans.
	Monitor budget performance and report variances with explanations.
	Track expenditures against project budgets and funding agreements.
	Prepare and submit donor financial reports as required.
	Monitor grant burn rates and advise program teams on budget utilization.
	Process invoices, payments, and staff expense reimbursements accurately and timely.
	Monitor receivables, follow up on outstanding balances, and ensure timely collections.
	Ensure compliance with local tax laws and regulations (VAT, WHT, CIT, etc.).
	Liaise with external auditors, tax consultants, and regulatory bodies as required.
	Prepare and file statutory returns and remittances on time.
	Maintain and enforce internal financial controls and policies.
	Recommend and implement improvements to accounting systems and procedures.
	Conduct periodic reviews to ensure financial integrity.
	Prepare monthly payroll, including deductions and statutory remittances.
	Maintain accurate payroll records and ensure compliance with labor regulations.
	Assist in procurement processes and ensure financial compliance in vendor payments.
	Provide financial support to project teams during proposal development and project implementation.
	Train non-financial staff on financial procedures, donor compliance, and budget monitoring.


Qualifications and Skills


	Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field (ICAN/ACCA certification is an advantage).
	3 - 5 years of accounting experience, preferably in a donor-funded or service-based organization.
	Strong knowledge of donor regulations (GCC, USAID, EU, UN, etc.) is a plus.
	Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Sage, or similar).
	Excellent Excel and analytical skills.
	High integrity, attention to detail, and ability to manage multiple tasks under pressure.
	Strong interpersonal and communication skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidate should send their two-page CV to: recruitment@brooksinsights.org using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply
